headline: Amazon's Twitch dominates game streaming market after Microsoft Mixer shutdown
summary: People watched 4.7 billion hours of video through Twitch in the third quarter. That's down 8% from the second quarter when the coronavirus lockdowns kept more people home, providing additional time to watch game streams online.

headline: Don't expect Hollywood blockbusters to return until more cinemas in New York and California reopen
summary: Many analysts fear that these blockbuster films won't return until there is a viable coroanvirus vaccine or California and New York reopen more theaters.

headline: Democrats and Republicans disagree on how to curb Big Tech's power — here's where they differ
summary: Even though Democrats and Republicans are in broad agreement that Big Tech has monopoly power, their differences on how to fix the problem make it doubtful sweeping tech regulation will come to pass.

headline: Americans think they need $1.9 million to retire. Here's how much you really need
summary: Chris Hogan is a financial expert and radio show host who helps people make better decisions with their money. Here's how much he recommends that you save for retirement.

headline: Trump advisor Corey Lewandowski spotted at football game without mask after saying he would self-isolate due to coronavirus concern
summary: Multiple people linked to President Trump have tested positive for coronavirus, including Trump himself, Melania Trump, Hope Hicks and Kayleigh McEnany.

headline: Watch live: World Health Organization holds Q&A on the coronavirus outbreak
summary: "Many deaths have been averted and many more lives can be protected," Dr. Mike Ryan, executive director of the WHO's health emergencies program, said Monday.

headline: Asset management companies face more consolidation after activist investor takes stakes in two big players, analysts say
summary: Consolidation may be inevitable for asset managers as Nelson Peltz's Trian Partners takes substantial stakes in Janus Henderson and Invesco, analysts say.

headline: Cramer: You're going to be on the 'wrong side of the trade' if you invest based on Trump’s tweets
summary: "If you're just going to look at the president's tweet, you're just going to end up on the wrong side of the trade," CNBC's Jim Cramer said.

Former Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer said on CNBC Wednesday: "I'll bet money that they will not be broken up," while discussing a House Judiciary antitrust subcommittee report that said Amazon, Alphabet, Apple and Facebook enjoy 'monopoly power.'
headline: Former Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer: I’ll bet money Big Tech won’t be broken up
Fed's Kashkari warns delaying stimulus will have 'enormous consequences'
summary: As the impasse in Washington intensifies, Kashkari told CNBC that workers, businesses and governments need more cash from Congress.

headline: September 2020 was the hottest on record worldwide
summary: Arctic sea ice also plunged to its second-lowest levels on record, scientists confirmed, as climate change takes an alarming toll on the region.
The Centers for Disease Control said Monday that Covid-19 can be transmitted through airborne particles. Here's what you need to know about preventing the spread.
headline: Now the CDC confirms Covid-19 is airborne — here's what that means for you
Why movie theaters remain in panic mode seven months into the coronavirus pandemic
summary: The movie business has a reputation for being recession-proof. But with the pandemic ravaging the U.S. and the world, is this the end of the movie theater business as we know it?
The dramatic fall and subsequent rebound of the market set the U.S. up for what looks like a “V”-shaped recovery. But whether the economy can continue to rally is still a question for investors.
The next center-right candidate to be German chancellor doesn’t have to come from Angela Merkel’s Christian Democrats, according to one of three candidates to lead the party.
headline: Merkel’s Successor Needn’t Be From Her Own Party, Contender Says
Congress just finished its Big Tech antitrust report — now it's time to rewrite the laws
summary: Subcommittee member Rep. Pramila Jayapal told CNBC new bills could be introduced within the first six months of the next Congress.

headline: T. Rex fossil sells for $32 million, becoming the most expensive dino ever auctioned
summary: A fossilized Tyrannosaurus rex, nicknamed Stan, sold at auction for $31.85 million, becoming the most expensive dinosaur fossil ever sold.
Stable Road Capital will take space transportation specialist Momentus public through a SPAC deal that values the company at $1.2 billion.
headline: Momentus to become the latest space stock with ticker 'MNTS,' valued at $1.2 billion in SPAC deal

summary: Piper Sandler raised its price target on Beyond Meat to $178, but MKM Partners' JC O'Hara is willing to get even more bullish on the stock.
headline: Beyond Meat stock could rally 32% to break to all-time highs, MKM Partners says
Amazon bullies partners and vendors, says antitrust subcommittee
summary: The House Judiciary subcommittee on antitrust said in a Tuesday report that Amazon's retail dominance gives it monopoly power over third-party sellers.
